page.title: 19Local Footpaths
page.content: Around the turn of the century, town planners such as Ebenezer Howard were developing the concept of the 'Garden City', were small areas of rural landscape were incorporated into the town structure to improve the living environment of the people. Now, 80 years later, the living environment is improving for a small section of the population, namely those who can afford to leave the city and live in the surrounding villages, travelling quite long distances to work each day by road or rail. In some cases this is leading to conflicts, as the newcomers usually have no tradition of country living. Here is an account from just one of these newcomers. "I live in Ugley where there is a lot of countryside and footpaths. My father has been interested in walking for a long time,
